prompts.proposer: Call proposer_brief_tool() FIRST. Then select candidates by name and choose a score_preset. Return ONLY JSON per instructions. IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY reference candidate names that appear in the tool output candidate_library; unknown names will hard-stop.
prompts.skeptic:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]
current_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5"]
prompts.statistician:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]
current_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "trimmed_mean_r0.05"]

raw.proposer:
{
  "selected_names": ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5"],
  "params_overrides": {},
  "score_preset": "balanced",
  "force_debate": true,
  "debate_margin": 0.05,
  "rationale": "High disagreement (relative_spread_mean=0.366) and horizon heterogeneity suggest combining robust baselines (baseline_mean), horizon-specific selection (best_per_horizon_by_validation), and learning-based ensembling (ridge_stacking) to balance stability and adaptability across varying model performance patterns."
}

proposer.rationale: High disagreement (relative_spread_mean=0.366) and horizon heterogeneity suggest combining robust baselines (baseline_mean), horizon-specific selection (best_per_horizon_by_validation), and learning-based ensembling (ridge_stacking) to balance stability and adaptability across varying model performance patterns.

skeptic.rationale: trimmed_mean_r0.05 (RMSE:162.7) and robust_median (MAPE:0.2189) outperform current candidates in stability and metrics; trim_ratio=0.2 aligns with recommended settings for few windows (n_windows=3).

changes.name: trimmed_mean_r0.05
changes.reason: recommended_knobs suggests trim_ratio=0.2 for few windows

changes.name: robust_median
changes.reason: recommended_knobs suggests trim_ratio=0.2 for few windows

skeptic.when_good: when n_windows is small (3) requiring stronger regularization/shrinkage

statistician.rationale: With n_windows=3, stability is critical. Adding trimmed_mean_r0.20 (higher trim_ratio for robustness) and removing underperforming ridge_stacking. Increasing trim_ratio on existing trimmed_mean_r0.05 aligns with recommended_knobs (trim_ratio=0.2) to reduce variance.

changes.name: trimmed_mean_r0.05
changes.reason: Recommended_knobs suggest trim_ratio=0.2 for few windows to improve stability

changes.name: ridge_stacking_l250_topk5
changes.reason: Underperforms compared to baselines and has higher instability (RMSE_std=103.44)

changes.name: trimmed_mean_r0.20
changes.reason: Higher trim_ratio (0.2) provides better stability for small n_windows=3

statistician.when_good: When n_windows is small (≤5) and model instability is a concern, especially with high RMSE variance across horizons.
